website_summaries.verdict: Perfect for an individual or smaller family, this electric grinder handles up to a cup of beans at a time. It also comes with a second bowl for use with spices.
pros: For use with coffee beans, spices, nuts and vegetables
Smart overheat protection helps to extend motor life
Comes with two removable stainless steel bowls, one grinder bowl and one chopper bowl
Bowls hold up to a cup of beans
Removable bowls are convenient and easy to clean
cons: Overheats and shuts off relatively easily, but this is to protect the life of the motor

customer_reviews.title: Still working strong after one year.
customer_reviews.text: Great Grinder. It has been more than a year in an Indian household for daily use. My wife loves it. Dry and wet grinding works great. I post this review because I also rely on reviews while making online purchase decisions.
customer_reviews.author: Review when it matters

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely waste of money
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product few days back. Today suddenly motor stopped working. Smoke came out of the motor. Electric motor is very week. Please avoid purchasing this product. Absolutely waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Sandy

customer_reviews.title: Stay away from this item....
customer_reviews.text: I just got this item.What a disappointment. Tried grinding some almonds, the item over heats and shuts down in less than 5 seconds??? Need to wait 15 minutes before it's ready for the next 5 seconds of use again.... You will spend the whole day in the kitchen for grinding and waiting.... Returning it today to the seller... What a waste of time and multiple trips to the post office ....
customer_reviews.author: nader dejkameh

customer_reviews.title: Do yourself a favor. Buy a more expensive brand ...
customer_reviews.text: Do yourself a favor. Buy a more expensive brand. All the plastic parts broke after merely 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: Asemani

customer_reviews.title: Terrific Coffee and Nut Grinder
customer_reviews.text: Great little grinder, well-built, and unlike those plastic ones, this one is pretty quiet (for a grinder anyways). Comes with two steel cups, one for coffee and one for spices and nuts. Worked great for over a year until someone skipped the directions, ran it for more than 30 seconds straight, and burned out the motor, so pay attention to that. The only thing I wish they'd improve is making the markings inside the cup stand out more, or duplicate the marks every 90 degrees, as I often had to spin the grinder all the way around until I could find the marks.
customer_reviews.author: Krkn

customer_reviews.title: Sounds like worn out wheel bearings
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to like it. But 2 things that really bother me. #1: very noisy not just the coffee grinding sound but like the grinding of worn out wheel bearings in a car. And #2: I grind Starbucks dark roast and it cakes to the bottom of the the container under the blade every time I grind.
customer_reviews.author: Norm K.

customer_reviews.title: Works great on hard ones like mustard seeds
customer_reviews.text: I use it to grind spices. Works great on hard ones like mustard seeds, Indian food spices, etc. The blade bowls are not waterproof and have some plastic at the bottom. If you use it for really pungent spices, you will probably never get all the smell out, no matter how thoroughly you clean it. A small brush helps but is not perfect. I still like it.
customer_reviews.author: Lorraine

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 2 months of very light usage
customer_reviews.text: Bought this grinder on July 21. My wife has only used it a handful of times, mainly to grind garlic. Yesterday she used it to grind sea salt and peppercorns and it stopped working. Not sure if it burned out or what. We had a Cuisinart grinder before this one which lasted for years. Very disappointed in this maker, would highly recommend against buying it.
customer_reviews.author: John Webb

customer_reviews.title: Leaks Horribly
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my wife based on such high reviews. She has tried it several times for various dry spices and nuts. All spill over the cap. Top lid does not seal well thus makes a horrible mess. No rubber seal on top that you push down to trigger on switch to grinder. Wet items makes a-royal mess (unusable). Now she has to use plastic wrap to seal top before grinding.
customer_reviews.author: familyjanardan

customer_reviews.title: Does a great job grinding dried peppers!
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this to grind up peppers we were dehydrating. It does a perfect job. The first time I used it I made the same mistake that others must have done: I didn't put the inside plastic lid on before the outer shell. Once I caught that, then everything has been great. I used it a number of times and it has really worked like a champ. We're very happy with the results. I have only used this to grind dried veggies with, so I can't testify to the versatility of this. But it does seem to be solidly built and has worked perfectly all this past summer and fall. As a spice grinder this unit is a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Kaveman

customer_reviews.title: Steel cup that was separable and the price point of ...
customer_reviews.text: Steel cup that was separable and the price point of ~$30 were the most attractive features for the order. However, upon receipt and use, found that the steel cup appears to be thin and pliable. Used it to grind spices - fennel seeds, coriander seeds, red chilies. The grinder does a decent job overall. It appears that the cup should be about half full to provide an even grind. The lid appears to not completely seal the cup resulting in the grind running up the cup and then to outside between the lid and side of the cup thereby losing the grind and creating a mess.
customer_reviews.author: JSK

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED....now in Secura's court
customer_reviews.text: The motor Seized up on me after only 3 uses. The product reviews were great and I loved the way the grinder looked. Yet I have to say...HIGHLY DISAPPOINTED that I purchased this in September and only got 2 good uses...and now that I need it for Christmas eve Spice grind....It seizes. I have called the manufacturer and was advised by phone clerk that an email will be sent to her management as to what options I will be given if any. It will take 3 business days (understandable a little longer due to the holidays)....but I hope to have something.
customer_reviews.author: noelle parrish

customer_reviews.title: Very nice spice grinder! We love it
customer_reviews.text: Very nice spice grinder, it's 1. Handy and light weight and jar is made of steel 2. easy to operate, just press the upper lid 3. Easy to clean since top container can be detached 4. Can grind wet and dry masala 5. Can grind ginger garlic 6. can even grind if it is very small amount
customer_reviews.author: Ayan

customer_reviews.title: Messy and inefficient
customer_reviews.text: The inside cup fts an outside one. If you don't wrap the inside cup in plastic, the powder goes all over the place in the outer cup that fits over the top. Whatever I grind gets caked on the blades because of the humidity it allows inside the outer cup. Awful, should be pulled from the shelves as it is the worst design on an item that did not need a reboot. I prefer the little coffee grinders. Spice Grinders are just supposed to have a bigger cup. Not a redesign.
customer_reviews.author: Macanoodough

customer_reviews.title: Virtually mess free!!
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I chose this Secura Electric coffee grinder. I almost chose a more familiar brand until I started reading reviews. This one produces very little to no mess and it’s pretty quiet for a grinder. It grinds my beans perfectly and since it has a snug lid, I can store what I didn’t use. Also as an added bonus, it came with a spice grinder. I only wish it came with a second lid. Overall, I’m extremely pleased with my purchase and would purchase again and highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Mendi Goolsby

customer_reviews.title: Does a pretty good job
customer_reviews.text: Grinder works well so far for coffee and spices. The only complaint it the cord does not stay in the provided groove. When you pick the grinder up and set it back down it is always sitting on the cord. The slot needs to be tighter or a grommet on the cord. Will probably just glue it in at some point but i shouldn't have to spend my time fixing design flaws.
customer_reviews.author: Don Truex

customer_reviews.title: Nice grinder
customer_reviews.text: I didn't but this for grinding coffee because I have a burr grinder for that. I wanted this for spices. It comes with 2 separate bowls, each with a different blade. One is for spices and coffee the other is for chopping veggies or nuts. The grinder works great for spices. It's too fast for nuts though, it chops them too fine for my liking. Both the bowls and clear top are dishwasher safe. It is a solid grinder, highly recommend it! My last grinder had plastic parts that came apart with age, won't happen with this machine!
customer_reviews.author: Janet Jones

customer_reviews.title: Sprayed food all over the counter
customer_reviews.text: I got this to grind dried herbs into powders. For whatever reason, even though it works, it also tosses what it grinds up over the top of the inner metal grinding cup and down between the outer plastic cover cup and the rest of the device as it goes. This results in all ground herbs ending up all over my counter, and none in the grinder itself. Useless.
customer_reviews.author: Dragon

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding grinder...
customer_reviews.text: This is a good grinder. It does an outstanding job of grinding and chopping a wide variety of things. I bought one last year for craft applications. This one is for kitchen use. They made a change in design. The grinder now comes with a plastic lid that snaps in place on the grindcup before processing. Nice addition. Still have to see how it stands the wear and tear of use though. I will only revisit this review if the snap on lid fails during future use. No update will mean it's preforming as it should. :-)
customer_reviews.author: Tee Kay

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for making Indian chutney.
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making Indian chutney. The grinder jar looks small in size, but can churn out a lot. You just need to load your ingredients in parts. I've tried grated coconut, cilantro, mint and nuts. All grinds perfectly with consistency in the chutney.
customer_reviews.author: Shrikanth Narayanan

customer_reviews.title: Lock before grinding
customer_reviews.text: It was working fine but once we ground coffee not realizing the bowl wasn't locked. It ended up chewing itself to pieces, including the the rubber seal.. Found it strange that it would grind without being locked in place. Since it came with two stainless steel cups we can still use it, but one seems designed for nuts and seeds, the other for coffee.
customer_reviews.author: chandelier

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to like this grinder
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this grinder, and I did for about 6 uses with the double blade and one use with the single blade. Both cups broke on the plastic end which secures the bowl in the unit. Now I have a paper weight. Wont buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: SterlingL

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my spice grinder. Definitely a step up from the coffee grinders, and I love the fact that their is an outer and an inner lid. I also love that the grinder cup snaps in separately from the cover. I have tried this for making purees and it is far superior than my small Cuisinart grinder. My Mr. Coffee grinder failed after just a few months...shame on you Joe DiMaggio...but this one so far has held up well.
customer_reviews.author: David Kieras

customer_reviews.title: Awesome grinder
customer_reviews.text: The Secura Coffee and spice grinder works great. I used it to grind smoked adobe and jalapeno peppers into dry spice. The Secura grinder has two cups with different blades in order to reduce the spices into powder form. It's important to note that you should not run the grinder continuously, rather pulse the grinder. This suggestion is clearly stated in the directions for use.I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ron Zoni

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Used only a couple times and worked well. Steel cup but plastic top. Would rather have all steel to allow better cleaning between spices. Spices can work into plastic but don't see that with steel. Most other grinders are all plastic so this one is better. Grinded up hot peppers to a fine powder. Also can partial grind but a little harder. Seems like some peppers would grind to powder quickly while a few pieces would take longer to grind. For partial grind I removed the done pepper than grinded the remaining. I suppose all grinders will do this.
customer_reviews.author: Derek

customer_reviews.title: Impressive quality
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I researched a lot of products before this purchase. She does a lot of cooking and was curious about the dual grinding/chopping ability of this product. We ordered and received the grinder and have been wonderfully surprised with quality and performance. We were also pleased knowing we made a wise purchase on a product we can use for years to come. Quiet and powerfull, you can't go wrong.
customer_reviews.author: WAYNE WOOD

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful job grinding grain berries!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for the purpose of grinding sprouted grain berries . It did a wonderful job! I was able to use the grinder cup to grind 8 cups of berries. The only thing I don't like about it is that the base gets hot. After the first 4 cups I let it set for a while to cool off. Even though it worked so well on my first use I'm not sure how long it will last. I will be sure to update again later but for now I'm excited it grinder all my berries into flour :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Durable, quick, easy to clean.
customer_reviews.text: We got this grinder over two years ago after several other grinders died after short periods of service. This grinder is still going strong. It is used for coffee 90% of the time, as my husband drinks quite a bit of coffee. The other 10% has been assorted spices, herbs, nuts and grains. It works well, is easy to clean and I have recommended it to others. I dream of someday getting a really nice bur grinder, but until then this will suffice nicely!
customer_reviews.author: Gardener

customer_reviews.title: This machine is strong!
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder packs a punch! My husband purchased it because we were exploring making our own tahini. Well, this machine was great! Since then, we have used it to grind spices, make pastes and sauces, and experiment with multiple other recipes. It is a super product. The blades are very sharp and the stainless steel parts are easy to clean. Also, they don't retain the taste and smell of the previous foods that were used in the machine. If you are in any way a foodie or just want a powerful little grinder, this is the machine for you!
customer_reviews.author: OC Nassar-Abukhater

customer_reviews.title: It stores nicely in our limited sized kitchen
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my husband who has to grind nuts to be able to eat them. He really likes the two cups to get a different sized product. It is an definite upgrade from the first grinder we had. It stores nicely in our limited sized kitchen. If we wear it out I would certainly replace it with another Secura.
customer_reviews.author: Toni

customer_reviews.title: Just what I was looking for!
customer_reviews.text: I cook and bake a lot. I have been looking for a good Spice Grinder that was easy to use and could grind dry seeds, pods and whole nutmeg or anise. I have been looking for over a year and was disappointed until I purchased the Secura Electric Coffee Grinder and Spice Grinder. I love it! Works Great! Grinds all my spices as fine as I need.
customer_reviews.author: karen

customer_reviews.title: Lovely Grinder
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a grinder for long time. When the moment came, I was looking for different products. The Secura brought my attention for its design and features. When I first looked at t out of box, I really loved the product and how it looks, with stainless steel design and two cups (one for fine grinding and the other one chopper). After I used it for many times, I figure out how strong it is, and How great functionality that it has. Its really strong, and worth every penny. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Ahmad Mahdi

customer_reviews.title: Perfect spice grinder, couldn't be happier
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted for grinding spices. Bowl is big but does small amounts of spices (I usually am only cooking for two) very well. Used the four blade bowl to chop up sun dried apricots, dates, coconut; no jamming no problem. The two blade even does small amounts (one or two seeds) of hard star anise beautifully. Large amounts no problem. Being able to really wash the bowls when I'm doing completely different cuisines is wonderful. And it's quieter than all the coffee grinders I've used. Chef's friend, seriously.
customer_reviews.author: Imareal Whinestein

customer_reviews.title: Great grinder!
customer_reviews.text: Great grinder! I use it mostly for making fresh Indian spices. It makes a quick job of cinnamon sticks and cardamom seeds. It has worked with everything I have done and with super easy cleanup.
customer_reviews.author: colorred

customer_reviews.title: Perfect to grind seeds to add to my smoothies
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this coffee grinder to grind flax seed, hemp seed, et al for my green smoothies. Thankful for the reviews that warn against running it too long. Just pulse a second or two at a time and within a coupe of pulses my seeds are well ground and perfect for my smoothie.
customer_reviews.author: S. E. Regan

customer_reviews.title: so far si good
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. I bought this to grind cinnamon. If I break cinnamon stick up into several pieces before grinding and grind one stick at a time it works. I love being able to wash the cups...my old one you just had to wipe out. The one design flaw I dont like is the lid being plastic and nit forming tight seal over cup. This allows for cinnamon dust to come out of cup and into top of grinder. I wish the top were stainless steel as well. You have to push down on top with hand so you andcreally see what is going on in cup anyway.
customer_reviews.author: BitoMom

customer_reviews.title: Awesome spice grinder/chopper
customer_reviews.text: Love this spice grinder. Comes with dry grinder and wet grinder stainless steel cups that are easily washable. My only issue with it is that there's no on/off switch. You have to hold the lid down to make the grinder run and inevitably I sometimes tend to take the lid off before the blades come to a stop and have spice flying all over :/. My mistake but wish there was a lock on the lid to ensure that does not happen. I use it to make ginger garlic paste which is ready in few seconds.
customer_reviews.author: L.Samuel

customer_reviews.title: Best non-burr coffee grinder I've ever had
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Powerful! Gets an adequate grind for a cone filter in about 15-20 seconds. - Grinds very evenly - Removable / interchangeable bowls make for easy clean-up and an easy way to pour your ground up beans into your coffee maker Con: - There's a bit of a gap between the bowl and the plastic cover which does cause a little coffee dust to get onto the inside of the bowl and onto the grinder base. But it's all easy to clean up.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Faircloth

customer_reviews.title: Started Smoking after 3 uses
customer_reviews.text: Started smoking two months after warranty ended while grinding coffee. I kept this grinder in spite of the fact that it claimed to be quieter than the rest, and wasn't. I liked the overall versatility of the two removable/rinse-able, bowls. But my 3rd time using it it started smelling like burnt rubber then started smoking from the base. VERY DANGEROUS PROBLEM! NOT VERY SECURA
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Good grinder.  Stainless Steel
customer_reviews.text: Works fine, grinds the coffee well. As with most small, high speed motors, it can overheat so the directions state that you should not run for more than 20 seconds. But, I find it cools quickly. I grind enough coffee for several days and the time emptying the cup and refilling seems to be more than enough for the motor to cool and keep going.
customer_reviews.author: RoBear

customer_reviews.title: Little machine, HUGE benefits
customer_reviews.text: This little machine is very powerful! I keep it on the counter next to my coffee pot and I can grind fresh coffee beans for every pot. Now, I buy better coffee beans and get a premium pot of coffee every time. It is very easy and a plus is that it can be used to also grind spices and nuts. Having such a versatile appliance makes my life easier in a lot of ways. It is a little workhouse of a machine.
customer_reviews.author: BJE

customer_reviews.title: Updating after years of use
customer_reviews.text: I grind coffee twice a day. This works well. The only con is that I need to take if off and shake it halfway through so it grinds evenly. This is no big deal and the end result is what is expected. Inexpensive and effective, would recommend to anyone who enjoys grinding their own coffee. Okay, I rarely give anything 5 stars but this grinder has been amazing for years now. For $30 I don't think you could possibly do better. I haven't even needed to use the second blade and cup yet. Convinced this will last forever.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Phoenix

customer_reviews.title: What a mess!!!
customer_reviews.text: We use it for grinding coffee and boy it goes everywhere! Do not go past the full line or you will have an even bigger mess!
customer_reviews.author: Beth R

customer_reviews.title: I love it
customer_reviews.text: I use this grinder for mincing herbs, garlic, shallots, ginger, as well as peppers from the garden, or different blends of rubs. Fairly easy to clean. I wish the power cord retracted or tucked away a little bit more neatly, but such is life.
customer_reviews.author: Jason N.

customer_reviews.title: Still working well
customer_reviews.text: works great. Only thing I wish, was a stainless steel cover instead of the clear plastic. I do not like the ground coffee touching plastic.
customer_reviews.author: dinodog

customer_reviews.title: Over a year and still going strong.
customer_reviews.text: I've had this grinder for over a year and use it almost daily. Has worked excellent and has done exactly what I have needed it to do. Use it mostly for grinding coffee for my French press. Seems very durable, easy to clean, and very low mess.
customer_reviews.author: jeff privett

customer_reviews.title: A well built and  very dependable Coffee and Spice Grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This is a 5 star grinder for both coffee and for your spices. It was safely packaged for delivery by UPS. The day I received it I used it, for grinding and chopping. I have utilised my Secura on an average of 4 times a week, and this grinder is a winner! The motor is strong and the blades are first class. Very, very importantly it is dependable. I have been a Chef and I am extremely critical of kitchen appliances. Each must meet my high standards. The Secura Grinder does.
customer_reviews.author: Taurus

customer_reviews.title: I have to let it cool off often so it won't get too overheated
customer_reviews.text: I use this to grind coffee beans and grind poppy seed. It works well for coffee; however, it gets hot very quickly when grinding poppy seed. I have to let it cool off often so it won't get too overheated. I have burned up a couple of grinders in the past grinding poppy seed for baking.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very versatile handy size grinder!
customer_reviews.text: We have used this grinder now for 6 months. We use it occasionally and have used it to grind a variety of spices. Make sure to lock the container properly.We had one occasion when the container dint lock properly and there was a burnt smell. We have used it many times since then and works perfectly. We would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: NJ

customer_reviews.title: Motor burned out after less than 10 uses
customer_reviews.text: When I first got the grinder, it was great. It ground quickly and with little noise. Unfortunately, the motor burned out after less than 10 uses while grinding flax seeds. There was even a faint smell of burning plastic coming from it. I'll be asking for a full refund and look for another grinder elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Denny

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly, love love love
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love this as a spice grinder. I make a complicated homemade chai, and OOF grinding the seeds, especially the cardamom. I used to do it with a mortar and pestle... I didn't think anything out there would tackle cardamom. The design is fabulous as it meets with function perfectly, I can control the pulse exactly as I would like. And it is SO affordable, and does a better job than the Cuisinart that my friend has.
customer_reviews.author: Erisa Devon

customer_reviews.title: Even following the instructions to a T can result in ...
customer_reviews.text: Even following the instructions to a T can result in the plastic parts of the interior breaking. Do not use this device for anything that could turn into a sludgy-like texture, so keep your ingredients dry.
customer_reviews.author: Jordon Birk

customer_reviews.title: Must for every home!
customer_reviews.text: Its a perfect grinder for grinding herbs, making purée, making chutneys. It's beautiful compact and has modern design. Stainless steel containers are awesome and are very easy to clean. Containers are of perfect size, big enough to make chutneys for a week. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: R.J.P

customer_reviews.title: Perfect! Just the right size for me in my ...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect! Just the right size for me in my small kitchen space. Now I can grind my coffee beans for multiple cups at a time, instead of grinding the beans every time I want my java. I'm also able to grind spices, so now I have one tool that can do multiple things for my small kitchen. Definitely recommend this for those that want to save space and money.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: I use this several times daily, to grind fresh ...
customer_reviews.text: I use this several times daily, to grind fresh spices for cooking (specially Indian Cooking). Has not been very long since I used it. But so far, it seems to be a very helpful little gadget. I almost never use the Chopper cup. The grinder cup grinds quickly and efficiently.
customer_reviews.author: Life as a conscious process

customer_reviews.title: Very nice machine looking great I have grated working very nice ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice machine looking great I have grated working very nice but the only thing twisting the jar and taking out the jar from machine it's quite difficult otherwise it functions well and will update later.
customer_reviews.author: Swathi

customer_reviews.title: Great coffee grinder
customer_reviews.text: Best coffee grinder, I even used it for indian spices grinding and it was just perfect powder. Used dry grinder for coffee, Indian spices (masala), dry fruits( almonds,cashews,pistachios) Used wet grinder for chutney, onion paste,tomatoes paste Its perfect what I need!
customer_reviews.author: miyan

customer_reviews.title: AVOIDABLE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a year ago. It had top rated with raving reviews. After limited use, it just stopped. Do not waste your money. Stay away. I shall not use one even if someone pays me to do so. Horrible.
customer_reviews.author: Mukesh Agarwal

customer_reviews.title: Deceptively powerful
customer_reviews.text: Its small size is very deceptive. It is a very powerful machine that is easy to use. We have had great success dry grinding and wet grinding spices. I was impressed when it made short work of something like annato seeds. Also the removable bowls mean that they are easy to clean unlike many other similar products.
customer_reviews.author: Andy

customer_reviews.title: Quiet, good grinder
customer_reviews.text: I like that this one is quite a bit more quiet than my last model. My last model was smaller and strong and lasted 25 years. I hope this one will last as well. Pleased so far!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just an okay grinder.
customer_reviews.text: This grinder has an issue as the cup that is supposed to contain the ground material has no internal lip. This causes the ground material (at least coffee grinds) to spill out the sides, making a mess in the kitchen. I have another grinder from this same Secura brand and it works fine as the previous plastic lid has a lip to better contain ground material. Not sure why the design was changed but appreciate the responsiveness from seller, Lafraise. On the plus side, the grinder is quiet and runs strong.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Broke After Two Months
customer_reviews.text: The grinder worked well enough for the time we had it. However, we had it for 18 months and largely used it for coffee over 2 months before it died.
customer_reviews.author: Storm

customer_reviews.title: This is a phenomenal little grinder; I bought a ...
customer_reviews.text: This is a phenomenal little grinder; I bought a 2nd one because I msitakenly thought I had burned out the first one, but when I fired up the first one, it had only shut off (perhaps an in-line fuse?)--great idea as I have gone through many brands that way. This one is durable and effective.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Klein

customer_reviews.title: This is THE BEST seed grinder
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a flax seed grinder. I have tried a few other brands and not all of the seeds got ground up. I read the reviews on the Secura Electric coffee and spice grinder and thought I would try one more time. This is THE BEST seed grinder. Very well made and comes with two different blades. All of the seeds get ground up and there is no gumming up on the blades. I highly recommend this product for grinding all kinds of seeds.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great for the price; it's no burr grinder, but it does a good job grinding coffee. I like that it comes with a second container; we use that to grind spices and nuts. It's also quieter than the average grinder.
customer_reviews.author: L. Tohline

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed Received broken parts
customer_reviews.text: Received the broken parts It’s look like someone already used it
customer_reviews.author: Zeshan

customer_reviews.title: Great for grinding flax seeds
customer_reviews.text: I use this to grind up flax seeds. Works very well. For cleaning, most of the time I simply brush the bowl out thoroughly with a little brush. If food sticks I wash it in hot, soapy water in the sink.
customer_reviews.author: tygereye50

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: I am happy with this coffee grinder. I have used it many times without any issues. The previous brand I bought died within the first 20 seconds of use.
customer_reviews.author: Brian P.

customer_reviews.title: Great for Indian Cooking
customer_reviews.text: I needed a nice handy grinder for grinding small spices and also to mince ginger,garlic etc for Indian cooking. I have been used to the brands like Preeti and other but after reading bad reviews on them i decided to this product. This has been great. Its great for making small quantities of mint / coconut chutney!
customer_reviews.author: Nandeep

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: Very good grinder. Have owned for about a month or two now. I use mine only for coffee. Haven't used the other 4 bladed cup for cooking or herbs yet but I have no doubt it will work just as great as the other.
customer_reviews.author: Galvatron

customer_reviews.title: really nice addition to our kitchen
customer_reviews.text: This little grinder is perfect for grinding fresh onions/garlic/peppers/ginger as well as dried peppers from our garden. Have used for Indian spices too. Having two easy to wash containers is great. When we first tried the container with 4 metal arms it didn't work but we just had to press a bit harder on the sides and it works very well. Really nice addition to our kitchen.
customer_reviews.author: Luis

customer_reviews.title: works good for very small batches
customer_reviews.text: works good for very small batches. Only draw back is you can only run it 30 seconds at a time. Then you have to wait a bit and do it again. But over all, it works.
customer_reviews.author: Laurent Jacquemin

customer_reviews.title: very disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I am very disappointed with this machine after it just stopped working after 3 months of usage. For 3 months I was absolutely delighted to use it for grinding spices and coffee in my kitchen. I am feeling extremely bad for giving it a one star. I cant even return the product due to closed return window.
customer_reviews.author: kaustuk tendolkar

customer_reviews.title: Love the product
customer_reviews.text: Love the product. It does a great job grinding. I use it to grind spices for different masalas. I would have liked to give it 5 stars but took off one star because there is nowhere for the cord to wrap.
customer_reviews.author: Ashi

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Support
customer_reviews.text: I really like this coffee grinder, for all the features others have mentioned. However, I believe manufacturer support also warrants mention. I purchased this product from Amazon in April. After about 4 months my motor stopped working (probably my fault) and I emailed Secura. They requested I cut off the power cord and upload a photo of the dead unit, which I did. One week later a new unit is sitting in my kitchen ready to go to work. In today's world, that kind of customer support deserves some recognition.
customer_reviews.author: Donald

customer_reviews.title: Really cool grinder. I like the separate container that holds ...
customer_reviews.text: Really cool grinder. I like the separate container that holds the grinded coffee fresh. Can grind enough beans to make 3 coffees. I’ve had other brand’s grinder before for the same money but the motor broke after maybe 20 uses (even though the reviews were really good). Really recommend this one. 👍
customer_reviews.author: Marcin Heniborg

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product
customer_reviews.text: Well built, easy use, good performance. We grind all our spices in it. Dry or wet both grind fine. No spilling. Need to put on the lid properly and pressed tightly while grinding. Good for grinding Indian spices
customer_reviews.author: Saurabh Paul

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic grinder
customer_reviews.text: I researched this grinder prior to buying it and I'm so happy I bought it. It grinds cinnamon bark and elachi. It is amazing. It has two types of grinding mechanisms. It cleans well and is leaves no residue with oily spices.

customer_reviews.title: bed product
customer_reviews.text: whatever you put inside it spreads out and makes a big mess
customer_reviews.author: Imane

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: product as described, received when expected, packed well... happy customer! The grinder has 2 different grinding cups - both work great. I love the fact the cups can be removed for easy cleaning. I have had the unit for several months - no issues - works great every time. This is a keeper!
customer_reviews.author: kde

customer_reviews.title: Broke With Under 3 doz Uses
customer_reviews.text: With at the most 3 doz uses this broke. The plastic on the bottom around the blade broke off while in use. Poor quality! I wasn't fond of the mechanics of how you had to use it.
customer_reviews.author: regenaz

customer_reviews.title: Happy with spice grinder.
customer_reviews.text: I'm so happy with this spice grinder. I spent time carefully looking at reviews before choosing this one. My past two grinders both had problems. What I like about this grinder: powerful can reduce whole spices completely, easy to clean, two inner stainless steel cups one for spices and one for pastes. I made salad dressing in the paste one today, only a little not too full! I've been quickly mincing garlic and ginger. i can grind whole spices, then add them to a Thai style paste using both cups. I'm a professional cook, so this grinder is getting a lot of use.
customer_reviews.author: sidonie w.

customer_reviews.title: holds up well to non-coffee items
customer_reviews.text: It successfully ground up dry chilies, which is what I most needed it for. I also made pesto in it, and have ground different seeds and nuts: coriander, fennel, walnuts. I even make powdered sugar in it, and it's much more convenient than the blender. Very good purchase.
customer_reviews.author: SV

customer_reviews.title: Got just over a year
customer_reviews.text: It worked great for a year and a couple of months, then mid-grind it just stopped. Disappointed to say the least.
customer_reviews.author: M. D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Worthy
customer_reviews.text: Its mainly good for Indian spices. It grand so powdery. Actually I am liking this product
customer_reviews.author: Mohamed Siddik

customer_reviews.title: The Happy grinder
customer_reviews.text: Waited to post my review because i wanted to utilize the grinder for a while first. In short it works great so far after about 2 months of daily use. Had a cuisinart prior and paid twice as much abd it did last 5 years. The cuisinart was always a mess after use. My new Secura is mess free and is powerful plus you get a spice grinder aside the coffee grinder! My experience has been great so far. I hope it lasts 5 plus years!
customer_reviews.author: Azulrider

customer_reviews.title: Loved this product until it started breaking
customer_reviews.text: Loved this product until it started breaking. At this point -- three years after purchase, with only weekly use -- both removable stainless steel bowls have broken at the bottom rendering it unusable. Call me crazy, but I feel that a product like this should last more than three years.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Mellinger

customer_reviews.title: The best spice grinder with customer service to match
customer_reviews.text: A great product with customer service to match I use mine to grind spices, which are done quickly With ease. Mine was missing the cover disc which arrived within 2 days. It's the best spice grinder I've ever used in my many years as a home cook Excellent value for money.
customer_reviews.author: susan townes

customer_reviews.title: I Won't Mince Words
customer_reviews.text: The product does what I bought it for and more. Very straight forward and I love that it comes with a two blade and four blade grinder pot. My only complaint might be that the cord doesn't fully wrap up underneath the grinder but I didn't buy it for it's cord management. This unit replaced my dead Braun Coffee Grinder and I have to say I like this one much more.
customer_reviews.author: Donn E. Green

customer_reviews.title: Sounds weak, requires tool to clean
customer_reviews.text: It grinds, but it sounds like it is working VERY hard, as the RPM seems to pulsate. Its rated for only 30 seconds of use for each grind, requiring a cooling-off prior to next use. I find this disconcerting. Design of the metal cup requires use of some sort of tool from your utensil drawer to get all of the grinds out each time. Is this the best you can do, China?
customer_reviews.author: Paul A. Dietrich

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working just after warranty expired
customer_reviews.text: I bought this grinder after being convinced by great rating. It worked great initially, but just after the warranty ran out, the grinder started giving me issues. Now it doesn't grind spices at all. The blades work, but it just lost the power to grind the spices. The motor becomes really hot and then stops working. Really disappointed with the quality.
customer_reviews.author: m4n1sh

customer_reviews.title: good size cup
customer_reviews.text: well made grinder...heavy duty for many jobs,,,had problem separating the two grinders that were packed together...had to use screwdriver and hammer to get them apart...good size cup...attractive on counter..
customer_reviews.author: cannabina

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Great product. Just what I was looking for to going dry spices. Cups are large enough, stainless steel.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for use at work. It's working as we hoped and quit useful. I would have liked to have had a choice as to the two grinder cups received. One gets used regularly, the other not at all. But we like being able to see through the cup that covers the grinder attachment. Very sleek and easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Aly

customer_reviews.title: I like it but wish I didn't have to hold on ...
customer_reviews.text: I like it but wish I didn't have to hold on the lid to get it to run. Its like I cant actually multi--task and do something else since my one hand is on the lid holding it down - A design flaw.
customer_reviews.author: Melvin Monteiro

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service!
customer_reviews.text: The motor burnt after a year of moderate use, however I was impressed by the costomer service. They have a great customer service which rially care about customers, and very responsive. Thank you Lafraise.

customer_reviews.text: very disappointed, did not work at all. Had a little sparkle on the bottom first time I used. then it smoked. Stopped straight away. Contacted Amazon that were ok for me to return it, but I had to pay the delivery cost back from Australia to US and that was over $70!!! Definitely not worth doing it considering the product was faulty!! And cheaper the cost of the unit then the item itself... Can anybody help???

customer_reviews.title: Grinds coffee very well, noisy though.
customer_reviews.text: Grinds coffee very well, which is the primary purpose so I can't complain. Hard to clean the base unit and noisy, but I would still buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good little grinder
customer_reviews.text: This grinder works quite well. Grinds my coffee for my morning fix rapidly and efficiently. I like that the grinding bowl detaches and therefore makes it easy to transfer the grounds to the coffee pot. I also like that there is a separate bowl for grinding spices. Although I haven't yet used the spice grinder, I look forward to it and expect it to be as good as the coffee grinder.
customer_reviews.author: S. Meade

customer_reviews.title: Not so great
customer_reviews.text: Doesnt work well. Blades blunt after a month's use. Ground only coconut pieces and veggies mostly
